examples: 'mozilla/5.0 (macintosh; intel mac os x 10_14_5) applewebkit/537.36 (khtml, like gecko) chrome/75.0.3770.100 safari/537.36'

is.desc: Client browser details (property names depend on browser)

versionNumber.desc: Major browser version as a number

nativeMobile.desc: Whether the platform is a native mobile wrapper

nativeMobileWrapper.desc: Type of the native mobile wrapper

bex.desc: Whether the platform is BEX(Browser Extension)

linux.desc: Whether the operating system is Linux

mac.desc: Whether the operating system is Mac OS

win.desc: Whether the operating system is Windows

cros.desc: Whether the operating system is Chrome OS

chrome.desc: Whether the browser is Google Chrome

edge.desc: Whether the browser is Microsoft Edge Legacy

edgeChromium.desc: Whether the browser is Microsoft Edge (Chromium)

ie.desc: Whether the browser is Internet Explorer

webkit.desc: Whether the browser is a Webkit or Webkit-based one

android.desc: Whether the operating system is Android

ios.desc: Whether the operating system is iOS

ipad.desc: Whether the device is an iPad

iphone.desc: Whether the device is an iPhone

ipod.desc: Whether the device is an iPod

kindle.desc: Whether the device is a Kindle

winphone.desc: Whether the operating system is Windows Phone

blackberry.desc: Whether the device is a Blackberry

playbook.desc: Whether the device is a Blackberry Playbook

silk.desc: Whether the browser is Amazon Silk

examples: { chrome: true, version: '71.0.3578.98', versionNumber: 71, mac: true, desktop: true, webkit: true, name: 'chrome', platform: 'mac' }

touch.desc: Client browser runs on device with touch support

webStorage.desc: Client browser has Web Storage support

iframe.desc: Does the app run under an iframe?

parseSSR.desc: For SSR usage only, and only on the global import (not on $q.platform)

returns.desc: Platform object (like $q.platform) for SSR usage purposes
